Authors:
Sean Michael Rovito, Gabriela Parra-Olea, Carlos Roberto
Vásquez-Almazán, Roberto Luna-Reyes, David B. Wake
Title:
Deep divergences and extensive phylogeographic structure in a
clade of lowland tropical salamanders
Keywords:
salamander, phylogeography, Mesoamerica, Isthmus of
Tehuantepec, biogeography, Bolitoglossa
Abstract:
Background: The complex geological history of Mesoamerica
provides the opportunity to study the impact of multiple biogeographic
barriers on population differentiation. We examine phylogeographic
patterns in a clade of lowland salamanders (Bolitoglossa subgenus
Nanotriton) using two mitochondrial genes and one nuclear gene. We use
several phylogeographic analyses to infer the history of this clade and
test hypotheses regarding the geographic origin of species and location
of genetic breaks within species. We compare our results to those for
other taxa to determine if historical events impacted different species
in a similar manner.
